title: How to Remove the Ask Toolbar from Chrome

steps.title: Click the Chrome menu button on the browser toolbar, select “Tools” and then click on “Extensions.
steps.content: Click the Chrome menu button on the browser toolbar, select “Tools” and then click on “Extensions. ”

steps.title: Select the “Extensions” tab.
steps.content: Select the “Extensions” tab.

steps.title: Remove the Ask Toolbar by clicking the small trash beside it.
steps.content: Remove the Ask Toolbar by clicking the small trash beside it.

steps.title: Click the Chrome menu button again.
steps.content: Click the Chrome menu button again.

steps.title: Click on “Settings.
steps.content: Click on “Settings. ”

steps.title: Click on “Manage search engine.
steps.content: Click on “Manage search engine. ” (This is in the Search section.)

steps.title: Set the Chrome default search engine to google.com by clicking the “Make Default” button and select “Google.
steps.content: Set the Chrome default search engine to google .com by clicking the “Make Default” button and select “Google . ”

steps.title: Search for Ask.com in the Search Engines list, and delete it by clicking “X.
steps.content: Search for Ask .com in the Search Engines list, and delete it by clicking “X . ”

steps.title: See if you get the following message on the Extensions page.
steps.content: See if you get the following message on the Extensions page. “This extension is managed and cannot be removed or disabled.”

steps.title: Close Chrome.
steps.content: Close Chrome.

steps.title: Right click on an empty part of the task bar.
steps.content: Right click on an empty part of the task bar.

steps.title: Select “Start Task Manager.
steps.content: Select “Start Task Manager. ”

steps.title: Click on the “Processes” tab.
steps.content: Click on the “Processes” tab. See if chrome.exe*32 is still running and select it if it is.

steps.title: Click on "End process.
steps.content: Click on "End process. "

steps.title: Open Control Panel.
steps.content: Open Control Panel.

steps.title: Select “Programs and Features” or “Add or Remove Programs” or simply "Programs"(depending on your operating system.
steps.content: Select “Programs and Features” or “Add or Remove Programs” or simply "Programs"(depending on your operating system. ) For Windows 8 users, right click on the bottom left corner and select “Control panel.” Then select “Uninstall a program.”

steps.title: Uninstall the Ask toolbar and Ask Toolbar Updater.
steps.content: Uninstall the Ask toolbar and Ask Toolbar Updater.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer.

steps.title: Go to “disk cleanup.
steps.content: Go to “disk cleanup. ” You can search for this in the search box by clicking the Windows Start button.

steps.title: Select your hard drive (probably C).
steps.content: Select your hard drive (probably C).

steps.title: Click “OK” to clean up the drive.
steps.content: Click “OK” to clean up the drive. Wait for this to complete.

steps.title: Click the Chrome menu.
steps.content: Click the Chrome menu.

steps.title: Select “Settings.
steps.content: Select “Settings. ”

steps.title: Click “Show advanced settings.
steps.content: Click “Show advanced settings. ”

steps.title: Click “Content Settings.
steps.content: Click “Content Settings. ” This is in the “Privacy” section.

steps.title: Delete cookies in the “All Cookies and site data” section.
steps.content: Delete cookies in the “All Cookies and site data” section.

steps.title: If the above does not work, click the chrome menu and go to "settings".
steps.content: If the above does not work, click the chrome menu and go to "settings". Under "On start up", click " set pages" . Delete ask.com and assign your desired page.

steps.title: Download Malwarebytes for free at malwarebytes.org/products/malwarebytes_free/ to ensure there is no malware left on your computer.
steps.content: Download Malwarebytes for free at malwarebytes .org/products/malwarebytes_free/ to ensure there is no malware left on your computer .

steps.title: Double click to install the program.
steps.content: Double click to install the program.

steps.title: Follow the on screen steps to install it.
steps.content: Follow the on screen steps to install it.

steps.title: Click “Finish.
steps.content: Click “Finish. ”

steps.title: Select “Hyper Scan” to perform a quick check on your system for active threats.
steps.content: Select “Hyper Scan ” to perform a quick check on your system for active threats.

steps.title: Click “Scan.
steps.content: Click “Scan. ”

steps.title: Wait for the scan to complete.
steps.content: Wait for the scan to complete.

steps.title: Notice the resulting malware discovered, select all and click “Apply Actions.
steps.content: Notice the resulting malware discovered, select all and click “Apply Actions. ”

steps.title: Download the tool from Ask.com. apnmedia.ask.com/media/toolbar/utilities/ToolbarRemover.exe
steps.content: Download the tool from Ask .com. apnmedia.ask.com/media/toolbar/utilities/ToolbarRemover.exe

steps.title: Shut down Chrome browser.
steps.content: Shut down Chrome browser.

steps.title: Run the tool remover you downloaded.
steps.content: Run the tool remover you downloaded.

steps.title: Restart Chrome.
steps.content: Restart Chrome.

steps.title: Notice that the Ask extension has now gone.
steps.content: Notice that the Ask extension has now gone.
